subject: Economics
title: Bretton Woods Institutions: Designing the Global Economy
description: A quick, practical guide to Bretton Woods Institutions: Designing the Global Economy.

hook.text: In 1944, the victors of WWII created three institutions to prevent another economic catastrophe.

buildup.text: The IMF would stabilize currencies. The World Bank would fund reconstruction. GATT would reduce trade barriers.

discovery.text: These institutions helped create the greatest period of prosperity in human history.

twist.text: Critics say these institutions serve rich countries. IMF austerity programs devastated developing nations.

climax.text: The Bretton Woods institutions shaped globalization's rules.

punchline.text: The rules of the global economy were written by the countries that already won.

quiz.question: What criticism is commonly made of the Bretton Woods institutions?
options: They primarily serve rich countries' interests and IMF austerity programs have harmed developing nations
